comments: For n>0, let b be the smallest nonnegative integer such that 2^m_1 > 3^m_2 > ... > prime(n)^m_n, where m_i is the exponent satisfying prime(i)^m_i <= b < prime(i)^(m_i+1). This sequence records the exponent m_1 for b because b=2^m_1. - _Tom Edgar_, Dec 05 2014
references: N. J. A. Sloane and Simon Plouffe, The Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences, Academic Press, 1995 (includes this sequence).
links: R. B. Eggleton, P. ErdÅ‘s and J. L. Selfridge, The powers that be, Amer. Math. Monthly, 83 (1976), 801-805.
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_
extensions: Offset, a(8) corrected and a(13) from _Sean A. Irvine_, Dec 22 2015
